EmailTemplate.subject: Honeywell Aerospace VHF Data Radio Product Line Update
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/]]> Honeywell Aerospace recently announced the site closure of the Renton, Washington location. As a result, the Repair & Overhaul activity for the RTA-44D VHF Data Radio is moving to the Honeywell Olathe, Kansas facility. The Olathe facility currently houses both a repair line and the OEM spares production line. The additional equipment from Renton will augment and expand the current repair volume. The teardown of the Renton line begins June 29, 2019.
A review of the repair history for the past 2.5 years indicates that you have sent in a part number for repair for at least one of the impacted part numbers.

REPAIR UNIT SHIPMENTS
- The last date that Renton will receive hardware for repair is June 28, 2019. Through June 28, Honeywell will work to fulfill repair orders already on site at Renton. - Due to the nature of the repair and/or the timing of the receipt of the hardware relative to the repair lead-times, some repair orders may require a place of performance purchase order or contract modification. - If a modification is required, your Honeywell Customer Business Manager, Honeywell Contracts Manager or Honeywell Support Representative will contact you to advise and coordinate the activity. - Watch for PO or contract modification correspondence coming from AeroRepairs@Honeywell.com <[[mailto:AeroRepairs@Honeywell.com]]>.
To minimize issues or delays with the repair of your hardware, please follow the following guidelines and actions.
Update your Authorized Supplier List and Internal Systems
